page.title: 10Growth of the Village
page.content: The village began to change consider- ably when the Bunbury Estate was sold off in 1914, from then on private houses were built in the area of the South drive to the old Hall.Houses were also built along Mill Rd. and Conyers Green. Since 1946 Elms Close & Cox Lane houses were built.In 1965 Hall Park estate was begun and is completed. In 1967 Conyers Way was developed and houses in that area are still being built. In 1975 Barton Hamlet was begun. This development is actually in Pakenham but people consider themselves Bartonians. Electricity was brought to the village in 1935\38. The first buses came from Bury in 1929. The village was put on the main sewer after 1945 when Thurston Sewage Works was built.
